trans-unit.source: A database is stored in files that live in a directory of the same name as the database. Database directories typically live in system directories.

seg-source.mrk: A <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database is stored in files that live in a directory of the same name as the database.
Database directories typically live in system directories.

target.mrk: A <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database is stored in files that live in a directory of the same name as the database.
Database directories typically live in system directories.

trans-unit.source: An in-memory database does not use the file system, but the size limits listed in the table later in this topic still apply. For some limits, the maximum value is determined by the available main memory instead of the available disk space and file system limitations.

seg-source.mrk: An in-memory database does not use the file system, but the size limits listed in the table later in this topic still apply.
For some limits, the maximum value is determined by the available main memory instead of the available disk space and file system limitations.

target.mrk: An in-memory database does not use the file system, but the size limits listed in the table later in this topic still apply.
For some limits, the maximum value is determined by the available main memory instead of the available disk space and file system limitations.

trans-unit.source: A database directory contains the following, as shown in the following figure.

seg-source.mrk: A database directory contains the following, as shown in the following figure.

target.mrk: A database directory contains the following, as shown in the following figure.

trans-unit.source: Contains files that make up the database transaction log, used internally for data recovery (not the same thing as the error log).

seg-source.mrk: Contains files that make up the database transaction log, used internally for data recovery (not the same thing as the error log).

target.mrk: Contains files that make up the database transaction log, used internally for data recovery (not the same thing as the error log).

trans-unit.source: Contains one file for each user table, system table, and index (known as conglomerates).

seg-source.mrk: Contains one file for each user table, system table, and index (known as conglomerates).

target.mrk: Contains one file for each user table, system table, and index (known as conglomerates).

trans-unit.source: A text file with internal configuration information.

seg-source.mrk: A text file with internal configuration information.

target.mrk: A text file with internal configuration information.

trans-unit.source: (might not exist.) A temporary directory used by <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> for large sorts and deferred updates and deletes. Sorts are used by a variety of SQL statements. For databases on read-only media, you might need to set a property to change the location of this directory. See "Creating <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Databases for Read-Only Use".

seg-source.mrk: (might not exist.) A temporary directory used by <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> for large sorts and deferred updates and deletes.
Sorts are used by a variety of SQL statements.
For databases on read-only media, you might need to set a property to change the location of this directory.

target.mrk: (might not exist.) A temporary directory used by <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> for large sorts and deferred updates and deletes.
Sorts are used by a variety of SQL statements.
For databases on read-only media, you might need to set a property to change the location of this directory.

trans-unit.source: (might not exist.) A directory in which jar files are stored when you use database class loading.

seg-source.mrk: (might not exist.) A directory in which jar files are stored when you use database class loading.

target.mrk: (might not exist.) A directory in which jar files are stored when you use database class loading.

trans-unit.source: Read-only database directories can be archived (and compressed, if desired) into jar or zip files. For more information, see <xref href="cdevdeploy11201.dita#cdevdeploy11201"></xref>.

seg-source.mrk: Read-only database directories can be archived (and compressed, if desired) into jar or zip files.

target.mrk: Read-only database directories can be archived (and compressed, if desired) into jar or zip files.

trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> imposes relatively few limitations on the number and size of databases and database objects. The following table shows some size limitations of <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> databases and database objects.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> imposes relatively few limitations on the number and size of databases and database objects.
The following table shows some size limitations of <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> databases and database objects.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> imposes relatively few limitations on the number and size of databases and database objects.
The following table shows some size limitations of <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> databases and database objects.

trans-unit.source: This table lists the size limits for common kinds of database objects.

seg-source.mrk: This table lists the size limits for common kinds of database objects.

target.mrk: This table lists the size limits for common kinds of database objects.

trans-unit.source: Some operating systems impose a limit to the number of files allowed in a single directory.

seg-source.mrk: Some operating systems impose a limit to the number of files allowed in a single directory.

target.mrk: Some operating systems impose a limit to the number of files allowed in a single directory.

trans-unit.source: Number of columns on an index key

seg-source.mrk: Number of columns on an index key

target.mrk: Number of columns on an index key

trans-unit.source: No limit. Some operating systems impose a limit on the size of a single file.

seg-source.mrk: Some operating systems impose a limit on the size of a single file.

target.mrk: Some operating systems impose a limit on the size of a single file.

trans-unit.source: No limit. Rows can span pages. Rows cannot span tables so some operating systems impose a limit on the size of a single file, which results in limiting the size of a table and size of a row in that table.

seg-source.mrk: Rows cannot span tables so some operating systems impose a limit on the size of a single file, which results in limiting the size of a table and size of a row in that table.

target.mrk: Rows cannot span tables so some operating systems impose a limit on the size of a single file, which results in limiting the size of a table and size of a row in that table.
